User provide high-level research directi.Format: Human selects domain (e.g., agents and virtual environments) and provides brief comments on ideas.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: Domain expert selects 50 ideas from 2000 generated, provides comments to refine them.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Defines the research focus and guides the ideation and planning stages.

User provide research papers.Format: Human-curated list of papers (57 recent papers in agent architectures and virtual environments).
User provide research papers.Example: Papers are input to the ideator for literature-grounded idea generation.
User provide research papers.Role in workflow: Provides grounding and context for LLM-based ideation.

User provide representations or formal i.Format: Library of vetted codeblocks for common research tasks (e.g., LLM calls, plotting, agent templates).
User provide representations or formal i.Example: 10 code snippets for LLM calls, ReAct agent, plotting, statistics, benchmarks.
User provide representations or formal i.Role in workflow: Constrains and enables feasible experiment construction by the system.

Query Decomposition.Method details: Ideator prompt encourages breaking down research programs into gaps, abstractions, extensions, and combinations.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: Structured research ideas with hypothesis, variables, metrics, pilot design.
Query Decomposition.Example: Prompt includes recipes for 'filling the gaps', 'combining ideas', 'challenging assumptions'.
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables generation of actionable, focused research ideas.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: Planning step converts high-level ideas into detailed, operational experiment plans.
Workflow Decomposition.Inputs: Selected idea, expert comments, codeblock library.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: Experiment plan with required codeblocks and operational details.
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Planner generates step-by-step instructions for experiment builder.
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Bridges ideation and code generation, ensuring implementability.

Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Method details: Ideator generates ~2000 candidate ideas by sampling combinations of papers and codeblocks.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Inputs: Randomly chosen pairs of papers, codeblock summaries.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Outputs: Large pool of candidate experiment ideas.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Example: 200 random combinations of papers used to generate ideas.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Role in workflow: Ensures diversity and coverage in ideation.

Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Method details: Human domain expert manually filters and selects 50 viable and diverse ideas from generated pool.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Outputs: Subset of 50 ideas for further development.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Role in workflow: Focuses resources on promising, feasible experiments.

Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Method details: Experiment builder crawls accessible benchmarks or environments to generate datasets for experiments.
Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Outputs: Automatically generated datasets for state prediction tasks.
Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Example: System crawls environment to create benchmark for state prediction.
Code-Driven or Tool-Augmented Data Retri.Role in workflow: Enables experiments even when external datasets are unavailable.

Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Method details: Human curates the initial paper corpus and codeblock library.
Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Outputs: Curated resources for ideation and experiment construction.
Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Example: 57 papers and 10 code snippets assembled by human.
Manual and Semi-Automatic Curation of Li.Role in workflow: Ensures quality and relevance of foundational resources.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: Ideator prompt includes recipes for decomposing research programs into actionable ideas.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Outputs: Structured research ideas with hypotheses, variables, metrics.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: LLM generates ideas by combining, extending, or challenging concepts from papers.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: Ideator conditions idea generation on content from selected research papers.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Prompt includes Latex of two papers for each ideation batch.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Ensures ideas are relevant and literature-informed.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Method details: Prompt encourages combining facets from different papers (e.g., methods, hypotheses) to generate new ideas.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Outputs: Novel research ideas via cross-over and mutation.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Example: Genetic operators like cross-over and mutation used in ideator prompt.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Facet Rec.Role in workflow: Increases diversity and novelty of generated ideas.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM-generated reports include explicit ratings of whether results support, reject, or are inconclusive for each hypothesis.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Automated summaries and ratings in Table 2.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Filters and highlights promising discoveries for human review.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Method details: External reviewers assess novelty relative to existing work; internal reviewer checks for implementation novelty.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Example: External review rubric includes novelty assessment.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Role in workflow: Ensures discoveries are not duplicative of prior work.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Method details: Experiments use statistical tests (e.g., bootstrap resampling) to assess significance of results.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Quantitat.Example: Bootstrap resampling for confidence intervals and p-values.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: External reviewers (domain experts) and internal reviewer (author) assess soundness, novelty, and code fidelity.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Example: Conference-style review and code review for 19 candidate discoveries.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Role in workflow: Final validation and filtering of discoveries.

Experimental Design Generation via Execu.Method details: Experiment builder generates Python code for experiments based on plans grounded in literature and codeblocks.
Experimental Design Generation via Execu.Example: Code listings for each experiment in Appendix H.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: LLM-based planner generates detailed experiment plans, including pilot/full experiment modes.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Inputs: Selected idea, expert comments, codeblock library.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Planning prompt produces operationalized experiment instructions.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: LLM converts experiment plans into executable code, iteratively debugging and refining.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Builder iteratively generates and refines code until successful execution.

Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Method details: Experiments are executed in an instrumented sandbox; results are logged and analyzed computationally.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Inputs: Generated code, simulated environments (e.g., TextWorldExpress, DiscoveryWorld).
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Outputs: Experiment logs, results, plots, statistical analyses.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Example: 250 experiment runs over 50 ideas, all computational.
Test Execution via Computational or In-S.Role in workflow: Validates hypotheses and ideas via simulation and analysis.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: Builder iteratively reflects on code and output, modifying code until experiment is successful or limits reached.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Example: Generate-execute-reflect debugging cycles in experiment builder.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Role in workflow: Improves experiment fidelity and success rate.

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: Meta-analysis aggregates results from multiple runs, examines consistency, and informs discovery selection.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Inputs: Summaries from 5 independent experiment runs per idea.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: Meta-analysis step classifies results as consistent, mixed, or limited.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Reduces variability and increases reliability of findings.

Refinement via Performance-metric.Method details: Statistical metrics (e.g., correlation, AUC, process score) guide assessment and refinement.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Outputs: Performance-based conclusions and further debugging if needed.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Example: Correlation between confidence and accuracy, ROC AUC, process scores.
Refinement via Performance-metric.Role in workflow: Ensures only robust, high-performing results are considered discoveries.

Refinement via Human–data integration.Method details: Internal reviewer reruns experiments with more samples, examines code and logs for errors.
Refinement via Human–data integration.Outputs: Replicated results, error corrections, final discovery selection.
Refinement via Human–data integration.Example: Internal reviewer vetoes or confirms discoveries after code inspection.
Refinement via Human–data integration.Role in workflow: Final safeguard for scientific validity and reproducibility.

paper_title: CodeScientist: End-to-End Semi-Automated Scientific Discovery with Code-based Experimentation
